org.jogamp.glg2d.impl

Class AbstractTesselatorVisitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jogamp.glg2d.impl.SimplePathVisitor
      • org.jogamp.glg2d.impl.AbstractTesselatorVisitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PathVisitor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CollectingTesselator, GL2ES2TesselatingVisitor, GL2TesselatorVisitor, TriangleStripTesselator

    public abstract class AbstractTesselatorVisitor
extends SimplePathVisitor
    Fills a shape by tesselating it with the GLU library. This is a slower implementation and FillNonintersectingPolygonVisitor should be used when possible.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.jogamp.glg2d.impl.SimplePathVisitor

    • Method Detail

      • setStroke

        public void setStroke(BasicStroke stroke)
        Description copied from interface: PathVisitor
        Sets the stroke to be used when drawing a path. It's not needed for visitors that fill.

      • beginPoly

        public void beginPoly(int windingRule)
        Description copied from interface: PathVisitor
        Starts the polygon or polyline.
        Parameters:
        windingRule - The winding rule for the polygon.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(float[] vertex)
        Description copied from interface: PathVisitor
        Specifies the starting location for a new subpath.
        Parameters:
        vertex - An array where the first two values are the x,y coordinates of the start of the subpath.

      • lineTo

        public void lineTo(float[] vertex)
        Description copied from interface: PathVisitor
        Specifies the end point of a line to be drawn from the most recently specified point.
        Parameters:
        vertex - An array where the first two values are the x,y coordinates of the next point in the subpath.

      • closeLine

        public void closeLine()
        Description copied from interface: PathVisitor
        Specifies that the preceding subpath should be closed by appending a line segment back to the point corresponding to the most recent call to #moveTo(float[]).

      • endPoly

        public void endPoly()
        Description copied from interface: PathVisitor
        Signifies that the polygon or polyline has ended. All cleanup should occur and there will be no more calls for this shape.
